p: Isolates of 2019‐nCoV to date are morphologically identical to coronaviruses under the electron microscope. Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which contain several viruses lethal to humans including severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS). The Coronavirinae family consists of four genera, Alphacoronavirus, Betacoronavirus, Gammacoronavirus and Deltacoronavirus (Chen, Liu, & Guo, 2020). Based on genetic properties, 2019‐nCoV belongs to the genus Betacoronavirus. In a positive sign of research collaboration, 2019‐nCoV sequences are being shared to enable analysis to generate insights into this novel pathogen ( https://gisaid.org/CoV2020).
